issue.title: [C++] import avro C++ code to code base.
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5569](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The goal here is to take code as is without compiling it, but flattening it to conform with Arrow's code base standards.  This will give a basis for future PR.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569?focusedCommentId=17187856) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Is this still something we want to pursue?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569?focusedCommentId=17188128) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield@gmail.com):*
I think so.  I probably won't get to this until sometime in 2021 though at the earliest, so we can possible close and I can reopen later.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569?focusedCommentId=17458098) by Will Jones (willjones127):*
Of note: if we want to support Apache Iceberg in Datasets, we may want an Avro to Arrow reader for the [manifest files](https://www.dremio.com/apache-iceberg-an-architectural-look-under-the-covers/#manifest-file), which I imagine could get big and numerous in large tables.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569?focusedCommentId=17459655) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield):*
`[~willjones127]` agreed.  If you want to pursue support for iceberg, I'd approve and try to help out with reviews.  At the moment it isn't clear when I will get to this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5569?focusedCommentId=17565635) by @toddfarmer:*
This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
